meanings.definition: Covered in or full of brambles
meanings.sent1: The path through the forest was the brambliest route to take.
meanings.sent2: The garden was overgrown with the brambliest bushes imaginable.
meanings.sent3: Trying to untangle the brambliest mess of wires was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a brambliest maze, twisting and turning with no clear path.
meanings.sent5: The brambliest thicket in the woods was a challenge to navigate.

meanings.sent1: Among all the bushes, the brambliest one had the most thorns.
meanings.sent2: The brambliest area of the field was where the wild berries grew abundantly.
meanings.sent3: The brambliest patch of land seemed to attract all the curious critters.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, tangled and wild, was the brambliest mess he had ever seen.
meanings.sent5: The brambliest corner of the garden was a haven for small creatures.

meanings.sent1: Her brambliest smile showed a mischievous glint in her eyes.
meanings.sent2: The brambliest artwork in the gallery captured the chaos of nature.
meanings.sent3: The brambliest pattern on the fabric seemed to dance in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: His words had a brambliest quality, sharp and unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The brambliest sound of the wind through the trees echoed in the quiet forest.
